intro: Curculigo fakimensis, commonly known as the Fakim's starwort, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Piperaceae, which includes species known for their aromatic and sometimes medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems, typical of many members of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
